titles.title: Help Veterans Own Franchises Act
A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow credits for the purchase of franchises by veterans.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

bill.summary: 5/22/2013--Introduced. Help Veterans Own Franchises Act - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow a business-related tax credit of up to $100,000 for 25% of the franchise fees paid or incurred by a veteran for the purchase of a franchise. Directs the Administrator of the Small Business Administration (SBA) and the Secretary of Veterans Affairs (VA) to provide information about the tax credit allowed by this Act to veterans service organizations and veteran advocacy groups.
